Why doesn't France support a war? Think you know? You may want to think again. 
 
 -France has supplied Iraq with most of its arms
 -France is owed billions by Saddam's regime
 -France built the nuclear reactor in Iraq that Israel took out 
 -France supplied chemcials for weapons
 -Money from Baghdad has gone right into Chirac's pocket
 
 Now we did some of this, but we stopped our support in 1991. France has not.

post_info.post_title: Why France Doesn't Support A War

I'm not disputing you, I know nothing of the subject, but you need to post your sources on things like this. Objectivity is paramount.

I do believe that France has finially gotten the message! Read the OpEd given by the leaders of seven European countries in the Wall Street Journal today. France and Germany among them. (Sorry I don't have a like for you)
I wrote this from an interview with a military expert, but these are ofted quoted... you should find them on most news stations and in many newpapers.

Cheese eating monkey cowards.
 
 For the last 100 years the French has been all over the globe screwing things up.
 
 Peace treaty after WW1, Korea, Vietnam, NATO, Africa, etc. If your going to use the military to fix your problems, at least have some guts to finish what you start. If your going to punish someone, don't complain if they come back and give you a bloody nose. My $.02.

the french did screw up the treaty of versailles in 1919. they wanted to punish the lights out of germany and send them back to the stone age. their hardline policy led to increased hatred of the french by germans who felt they were treated unfairly. this allowed hitler to rise to power. we all know what happened after that.
France doesn't want to go to war with Iraq, because they'd probably wind up surrendering. With France, that's sort of inevitable.
Look! The French military! *Points to two men with pistols in a small car*
The French also bought oil from Iraq. Everynoe knows it, but they still are trying to cover it up. Thats one of the main reasons they dont want to go to war.

Look! The French military! *Points to two men with pistols in a small car*

 
 Look! Its the French military saving America's XXX at Yorktown, ensuring the very independence of the United States. emoticon_rolleyes
Well, we are thankful for that but we need help right NOW. They are stabbing us in the back, and doing it with a smile on there faces.

France is stabbing you in the back? How does not wanting to participate in the ridiculous war against Iraq which Cheney, Wolfowitz, and Perle were describing in detail a decade before 9/11 equate to some sort of betrayal? Iraq has not attacked the United States, or anyone for that matter in years. Iraq is not about to attack France, it can barely support its own population.
 
 Why the hell should France want to spend BILLIONS of dollars fighting in an absurd aggressive war to increase terrorism? I constantly hear prattling on about "cheese eating surrender monkeys." That is quite frankly ridiculous. France lost an entire generation in World War 1, not to mention the toll it incurred in the Napoleonic Wars. France lost well over a 100,000 men in World War 2. French soldiers died for the very independence of the United States and again during the War of 1812 where Napoleon was the only thing that prevented Britain from crushing the United States, after burning down its capital, and after New England officially quit the War of 1812 and threatened to secede from the United States. France was occupied by the Third Reich, after being DESERTED by the Allies at Dunkirk, the surrender monkeys, whose next great action was to bomb the French Fleet in North Africa killing hundreds of French sailors! Try imagining 9/11 x 1,000,000,000 to try to grasp the utter devestation Europe experienced in the twentieth century. Germany lost MILLIONS of its citizens. Its economy, the entire nation was utterly erradicated by heavy allied bombing. America in its brainwashing program imposed upon Germany after the war is directly responsible for German pacifism today - the same is true of Japan. Russia lost tens of millions of its people in World War 2. Sorry, but the Europeans have a damn good reason not to rush off to war like the did with the enthusiasm of the Great War like the Yankees are doing today. France sold America literally half the United States with the Lousiania Purchase, the greatest fortune and piece of luck ever to befall a country in all of world history! Whereas Frederick the Great fought for seven years to gain Silesia, and two more wars to hold it; Napoleon and the "cheese eating surrender monkeys" emoticon_rolleyes fought for twenty years against six coalitions of Great Powers to control Western Europe; whereas England paid a son for every square mile of its Empire - America acquired an area the size of Western Europe itself for a pittance, because of France, this much reviled nation of all so evil cowards and America haters! The irony and arrogance of such a condescending attitude is utterly amazing!

French troops have this habit of giving up in modern times, like it or not. 
 
 Franc has 60 billion in oil contracts and make billions more in trade with Iraq... of course they want no war. 
 
 This is the first time Germany has taken a stance against the US, and it only Schroeder can keep a campaign promise, because he would have lost the election had he not been anti-American. 
 
 I admire Japan for not getting involved in the conflicts of others. After what had happened it was a good idea. 
 
 The Europeans simply think you can sit at a table with all people and make deals. NOT ALWAYS GOING TO HAPPEN. Iraq, North Korea. Clinton gave North Korea 6 billion and nuclear technology, and Clinton did a lot of bombing in Iraq and none of you said a word. You don't have to play politics here, so all of us should stop pandering to our labels.

I've got a friend from France, and he says they hate Chirac and elect him because the others have been out of power for so long. France has a large Arab population and a business relationship with Iraq, so of course they don't want a war. Who built France a nuclear power plant? France. Thank God Israel took that reactor out.

France is due the credit for the freedom we have in the US. It is the French liberal tradition that gave us a lot of our modern ideas of government.
 
 The French are also directly responsible for a lot of the unstability in the modern world. Everywhere they have been, they have left behind unfinished wars that have claimed a lot of native and US lives. Those graves there in Normandy, they are not French.
 
 A hallmark of how the French handle modern conflict is to see who the French send in to fight wars, the Forgein Legion. These are disposable men who are not French citizens.
 
 We can be arrogant. The world wants to mimic our images of the US getting jiggly on MTV, not the paintings hanging in Le Louvre.
It's kind of ironic...the French, once our greatest ally, now aren't considered much of an ally. The British, once our worst enemy, are now considered our greatest ally.
Of every single city that has been invaded or bombed in the 20th century, the citizens fought house to house or shot back except one, Paris.

The France joke! How many Frenchmen does it take to defend Paris?
 
 No one knows--it's never been tried.

A Brief Overview of French Military History:
 Gallic Wars- Lost.-In a war whose outcome foreshadows the next 2k years of French history, France is conquered by, of all things, an Italian.
 100 Yrs. War- Mostly Lost.- France is saved at last by female schizophrenic who inadvertently give the rise to the 1st rule of French warfare: France's armies are victorious when not led by a Frenchman.
 Italian Wars- Lost.- France becomes the frist and only country to ever lose two wars when fighting Italians.
 Wars of Religion- France goes 1-5-4 against the Huguenots.
 30 yrs. War- France is technically not a participant, but manages to get invaded anyway. Claimed a tie on the basis that eventually all the other participants started ignoring her.
 War of the Augsburg League/King William's War/French and Indian War- Lost, but claimed as a tie. Francophiles the world over label the period the height of French Militarty Power.
 War of Spanish Succession- Lost. The war also the the French their first tast of a Marlborough, which they have loved since.
 American Revolution- France claims a win even though the colinist saw far more action. This later known as "de Gaulle syndrome,"and leads to the 2nd rule of French Warfare: France only wins when America does most of the fighting.
 French Revolution- WON, becuase the opponent was also French.
 Napoleonic Wars-Lost. Temporary victories due to leadership of a Corsican (remember the 1st rule), who ended up being no match for a British footwear designer.
 Franco-Prussian War- Lost
 WW1- Tied and on the way to losing, France is saved by U.S.
 WW2- Lost. Conquered French liberated by the U.S. and Britain just as they finish learning the Horst Wessel Song.
 War in Indochina- Lost
 Algerian Rebellion- Lost. This marks the 1st defeat of a Western army by a non Turkic Muslim force since the Crusades, and produces the Frist rule of Muslim Warfare: We can always beat the French. This rule is identical to the first rules of the Italians, Russians, Germans, English, Dutch, Spanish, Vietnamese, and Eskimos.
 War on Terrorism- France, keeping in mind its recent history, surrenders to Germans and Muslims just to be safe.
 
 American Policy: Speak Softly and carry a big stick.
 French Policy : Speak Loudly and carry a white flag.

We're running around the world patching up every mistake they make... 
 
 Cavuto did a good job with this... There was a bully and a leader. The leader wanted to take out the bully. The French foriegn minister called him wreckless, Belgium said that he would upset the entire world order, and the bully took out ads in European papers saying that he had no intention of causing any damage. The leader was called a war monger at home and he was from the opposition party. The leader was Winston Churchill and the bully was Adolf Hitler. This story seem familiar?

I just saw a picture of a Frenchman in WW2 at the invasion of Paris. Picture is a thousand words.
 
 It is a picture of a Frenchman crying with tear flowing down his face as the Germans march into Paris.
 
 Classic French. Why is he crying? He should pick up a gun and shoot back. At the Paris invasion, the men universally watched and cried like women.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Why France Doesn't Support A War
